question: The eastern Chalukyan king Visnuvardhana rule is associated with which of the following periods?
explanation: Visnuvardhana was a brother of Pulakesin II. He asserted his independence from Pulakesin II and founded the Eastern Chalukya dynasty. His capital was at Vengi in Andhra. He ruled for 18 years from A.D. 615 to 633.
